response.answer: "Low budget" means involving or requiring a small amount of money or relatively low cost. It is often used to describe films, projects, or activities done with limited financial resources.

sources.name: Low Budget (song) - Wikipedia
sources.snippet:
"Low Budget" is the sixth track from The Kinks' album of the same name. It was written, produced and sung by Ray Davies. "Low Budget" was recorded in January 1979. It describes a man giving up his "expensive tastes" in order to save money. Like many of the tracks on Low Budget, it applies to ...
Although "Low Budget" refers to economic problems of the times in general, it also refers to some of Ray Davies' own personal concerns. In the song, Davies mocks his own fear of not having money and his frugality. The song also references Davies' vanity. The singer describes himself as once being well dressed and able to afford cigars, but now has to buy discount clothes and chew mints.
I like “Low Budget” [1979]. It’s wild. I like that kind of, almost country-style playing. It’s like a shape; I don’t even worry about what notes I play as I’m doing it. And if you catch a few open strings, you might get lucky with a weird clunk or a harmonic or something.
Of a performance in Binghamton, New York on February 18, 1979, the Binghamton University newspaper Pipe Dream noted that "'Low Budget' became an audience effort when Davies ceded his microphone to members of the front row during the chorus." In 1980, a live version of "Low Budget" (recorded at Providence Civic Center, Providence, Rhode Island, on 23 September 1979) was released on the album One for the Road.
He describes himself as "a cut-price person in a low-budget land." But despite being reduced to poverty, the singer expresses pride in his hair and his teeth.
Author Thomas Kitts notes that even the title, used in the refrain "I'm on a low budget" could refer to Davies keeping himself on a tight budget.

sources.name: Every Jurassic Park Movie Primitive War Beat With Absurdly Low Budget, Ranked
sources.snippet:
Primitive War's low budget is a testament to storytelling, as 4 Jurassic Park movies failed against this independently produced film in Critics' Score!
The director’s words potentially mean that the film was indeed made with a budget of somewhere around $7 million. Considering a low budget, it’s impressive that Primitive War has managed to beat 4 Jurassic Park movies in terms of Rotten Tomatoes despite a 10x lower budget!
Despite being the latest flick and a budget of $225 million (via The-Numbers), the film remained unfavorable to critics. According to Rotten Tomatoes, the critics gave the film a rating of 50% on the website, which is considered just an average flick. And on the contrary, despite having a much lower budget, Primitive War has impressed critics more than these four movies from the Jurassic Park/World franchise.
Directed and produced by Luke Sparke, Primitive War found worldwide fame for being a fresh take on the genre, as well as the astonishingly low budget with which it was made.
Despite a massive budget, Jurassic World Dominion wasn’t able to please critics, and Dominion is considered one of the lowest-rated movies in the franchise.

sources.name: Low Budget (album) - Wikipedia
sources.snippet:
Low Budget is the eighteenth studio album by the English rock band the Kinks, released in 1979. It was their first to feature bassist Jim Rodford who would remain with the group until their disbandment in 1996. Following the minor success of their 1978 album Misfits, the band recorded the majority ...
Low Budget is the eighteenth studio album by the English rock band the Kinks, released in 1979. It was their first to feature bassist Jim Rodford who would remain with the group until their disbandment in 1996. Following the minor success of their 1978 album Misfits, the band recorded the majority of the album in New York rather than London.
Despite being a relative failure in the UK, Low Budget was a critical and commercial success in the United States, becoming the Kinks' best-selling studio album and peaking at number 11 on the Billboard Top LPs & Tape chart.
Avory eventually agreed to stay, while ex-Argent bass player Jim Rodford, and keyboardist Gordon John Edwards were recruited, the latter having played with the Pretty Things on their album Silk Torpedo. Edwards was shortly afterwards fired from the group for failing to show up to sessions for Low Budget (although he recorded piano on at least one of the album's tracks), being replaced with Ian Gibbons following the album's release.
Recording for Low Budget began in early 1979 at the band's own Konk Studios in London, where "(Wish I Could Fly Like) Superman", the result of Arista founder Clive Davis's request for a radio-friendly hit, and the album's title track were cut. After these sessions, the rest of the album was recorded at the Power Station and Blue Rock Studios in New York City.
Along with the tracks that appeared in the final running order of Low Budget, versions of songs that would appear on the album's 1981 follow-up Give the People What They Want, such as "Destroyer" and "Give the People What They Want" (and possibly "Yo-Yo" and "Better Things") were attempted.

sources.name: Low Budget (2005) ⭐ 4.2 | Comedy
sources.snippet:
Low Budget: Directed by Jedrzej Jonasz. With Jeff Teravainen, Pat Thornton, Neil Green, Jennifer Newman. Wannabe L.A. filmmakers Jaye and Jason get hired for a travel show about Canada but divert the funds to make their sci-fi film "Invasion Q." Their journey across Canada humorously portrays ...
Low Budget: Directed by Jedrzej Jonasz. With Jeff Teravainen, Pat Thornton, Neil Green, Jennifer Newman. Wannabe L.A. filmmakers Jaye and Jason get hired for a travel show about Canada but divert the funds to make their sci-fi film "Invasion Q." Their journey across Canada humorously portrays the trials of independent filmmaking.
This is a really cool low budget (pun intended) movie about low budget film making. It follows two not so smart wanna be film makers, trying to make the film that might make or break them, by diverting funds from a travel show they were accidentally hired to produce.
1h 23m | Not Rated

sources.name: How to Budget With a Low Income - Ramsey
sources.snippet:
Budget feeling tighter? Having trouble making ends meet with your current paycheck? Learn how to budget your money with a low income.
Whether you’re stuck in a low-paying job or you’re battling inflation, I know it can be hard to make progress toward your goals—let alone make ends meet—on a lower income. Forget thriving. Maybe you’re just trying to survive. But no matter how much you make, there are things you can do to feel more in control of your finances. I’m going to walk you through how to budget your money with a low income.
Even if you have a low income, you still can (and should) make a plan for your money. It’s all about working with what you have. And a budget helps you do just that by telling your money where to go each month.
And if you work on commission or have an irregular income, just use your lowest monthly income as a place to start (you can always go up from there). Once you’ve got your total monthly income figured out, your next step is to plan for all your monthly expenses. (This is when you’ll use your bank account to get a better idea of your spending.) Before you can budget for the things you want, you’ve got to make sure the basics are taken care of.
If you have your emergency fund and you’re making the right decisions with your current income, you won’t have to rely on debt to bail you out. And if you’ve already got debt, paying it off will help you free up your budget that much more! Low income or not, you can still have control over your money by making and sticking to a budget.

sources.name: 10 Ways to Live the Big Life on a Small Budget - UHFCU
sources.snippet:
Consider Alternative Accommodations When you’re traveling on a budget, remember that a hotel is not the only option for lodging. Consider alternatives like Airbnb, Couchsurfing and Home Exchange to save money.
Eat Well on Less If you’re wondering how to live on a budget but still eat well, scope out nearby farmer’s markets to find local, quality produce.
Reference https://www.gobankingrates.com/saving-money/budgeting/ways-live-big-life-small-budget/.

sources.name: 30 practical things to do on a low-budget lifestyle
sources.snippet:
John Lowe of MoneyDoctors.ie advises on 30 things that you could do without spending a fortune or even any money at all.
John Lowe of MoneyDoctors.ie advises on 30 low-cost or no-cost things to do to help you stay productive, entertained, and thriving. 1. Create a budget and track expenses. Start by understanding where your money goes. Use a simple spreadsheet or a free app to track every expense.
26. Limit social spending. Instead of going out, opt for low-cost or free activities with friends. Hosting a movie night or potluck can be fun and budget-friendly.
29. Find free or low-cost hobbies. Engage in hobbies that don’t require spending, like drawing, writing, hiking, jogging or playing music. These activities enrich your life without draining your budget.
For more information, click on John Lowe's profile above or on his website.
